title: Assistant Teacher
description:
We are looking for a committed assistant teacher to work in our center! We are seeking nurturing, friendly professionals to complement our qualified workforce of educators. You will be responsible for assisting the teacher in implementing age-appropriate lesson plans. It will be fundamental to provide knowledge and instruction to students while also helping them develop their personalities and skills. The ideal candidate will be passionate about the job with an ability to reach out to young children and create a relationship of mutual trust.

**Responsibilities**

* Engage children in the learning centers
* Provide individualized instruction to each student by promoting interactive learning
* Create a positive classroom environment
* Maintain a healthy classroom environment and orderly classroom
* Develop and enrich professional skills and knowledge by attending seminars, conferences etc.

**Skills**

* One Year of proven experience as an Assistant Teacher
* Excellent communicability and interpersonal skills
* Well-organized and committed
* Creative and energetic
* Knowledge of CPR and First Aid
* Sanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place
* Physically able to perform tasks including bending, lifting, and sitting on the floor.
* Be willing to be animated with the children including dancing and singing
* Computer skills

Full-time Monday - Friday from 9:00 to 6:00 or 2:00pm to 6:00 pm

**Minimum Requirements**  
College Credits in Early Childhood  
Covid 19 vaccination  
1 Year of classroom experience as an Infant Toddler caregiver, Assistant Teacher, or Afterschool caregiver

Spanish speaking is a plus. CPR is a plus.

Please attach your resume. Thank you!

title: Director of Operations
description:
**Director of Operations**

**Job Description**

**Status:** Full-Time

**Reports To:** Executive Director

**Start Date:** Mid-September 2024

**Location:** East Orange, NJ (Hybrid, Tuesdays and Thursdays in office)

**Salary: 105k-125k**

*Commensurate with the candidate's experience*

**About PHEI:**

The Perinatal Health Equity Initiative is a Black female led, 501c3 nonprofit organization dedicated to eliminating disparities in Black infant and maternal health in New Jersey. We do this by providing direct clinical care, advocacy, policy, education, research, and community engagement. We are rooted in Reproductive Justice, Social Justice and anti racist framework designed to create health equity for Black mamas. Our offices are based in East Orange, and Orange, New Jersey and provide support to the surrounding communities.

At The Perinatal Health Equity Initiative (PHEI), we are dedicated to putting Black mamas first, driven by a deep love and passion for their well-being. Our mission is to meet the needs of Black mothers by amplifying their voices and partnering with them to reimagine a better future for Black mamas and their babies. As a team member, you will be expected to uphold the highest standards of ethics, operating with integrity and accountability to serve our communities with unwavering moral clarity. We strive to create an environment grounded in ethical principles, fostering trust and respect among our team and the families we support.

Our culture emphasizes a sense of ownership, encouraging everyone to take pride in their work, embrace responsibility, and be accountable for their contributions. Transparent communication is the bedrock of our organization. We are committed to fostering open, honest, and inclusive dialogue that empowers every individual within our organization and the communities we serve. Your dedication to transparency will be crucial in our efforts to create a more equitable and just healthcare system for Black mothers and their babies.

**Job Summary:**

The Director of Operations will act as a key strategic partner and co-pilot to the Executive Director, driving the day-to-day operations of the organization while supporting its long-term vision. This role is pivotal in identifying and optimizing internal processes to ensure efficient and effective delivery of programs and services. The Director of Operations will be adept at zooming in on detailed operational tasks and zooming out to understand and influence the broader organizational structure and strategy.

Key responsibilities include developing and implementing innovative ideas, overseeing resource allocation, and aligning operational activities with the organization’s strategic goals. The ideal candidate will demonstrate strong leadership, a strategic mindset, and a proactive approach to problem-solving. They should be comfortable navigating both high-level strategic planning and hands-on operational management, all while passionately advancing the organization’s mission.

**Core Responsibilities:**

* **Strategy and General Operations (65%)**
* Contribute to the development and execution of the organization’s strategic plan.
* Set and oversee annual goals and objectives.
* Establish KPI’s to monitor and analyze operational performance.
* Identify and implement opportunities for operational enhancements and innovation.
* Support organizational growth and development initiatives.
* Facilitate cross-departmental collaboration to achieve organizational goals.
* Drive the design, implementation, and improvement of organizational policies, procedures, and norms consistent with organizational strategies, business models, values, and mission.
* Maintain effective communication channels with staff, board members, and stakeholders.
* Oversee the organizational culture work and work with staff to ensure that our internal culture aligns with our external approaches to the work.
* Manage and streamline daily operations to ensure efficiency and effectiveness.
* Maintain organizational systems and processes, such as in partnership with other team members who rely on these systems to carry out programmatic work.
* Identify and integrate appropriate communication streams with other work areas including programming, and fundraising
* Determine, set up, and oversee staff coordination of Internal data and organization systems. Establish security passwords and security systems.
* Maintain records, manage organizational insurance and legal filings and relationships
* Ensure and maintain supplies, utilities, building/ rental relationships
* Ensure that we have the IT systems and infrastructure that we need to do all areas of work effectively - includes research, set-up, and maintenance
* Manage data and systems security
* Compliance and Risk Management
* Ensure compliance with all relevant regulations, standards, and best practices.
* Develop and implement risk management strategies.
* Monitor and address any operational or legal issues that arise.
* **Staff Management (20%)**
* Develop and implement all aspects of personnel management including hiring, onboarding, offboarding, training, and performance evaluations.
* Foster a positive and collaborative work environment.
* Identify gaps that exist in the current personnel and HR processes, craft and implement strategies to resolve
* Proactively work with Board Chair to hire the roles of Program Director and thoughtfully staff the organization in alignment with the mission and vision of the organization
* Manage critical HR processes:
* Process payroll for all employees
* Make sure that we have proper documentation for all staff, including both FT and PT employees and contractors
* Issue payments for all contractors, including establishing and overseeing payment schedule
* **Budget and Resource Management (10%)**
* Ensure the organization maintains sound fiscal health.
* Develop and manage the operational budget, ensuring efficient use of resources.
* Monitor financial performance and report on budgetary issues.
* Support the bookkeeper with aspects of the annual audit process, including organizing and maintaining receipt and documentation, finances, and pulling reports.
* Oversee and manage all aspects of account payables and receivables, in alignment with financial controls.
* Procurement and management of supplies, equipment, and services.
* Process donations and grants
* Manage accounting systems, including entering receipts and transactions into QB, managing relationship with bookkeeper, and overseeing production of financial reports
* Manage payment of all bills, process invoices, send invoices in a timely way.
* Work with Executive Director to track and produce financial information that enables strategic budgeting - includes filling out the monthly finance google doc
* **Program Support (5%):**
* Collaborate with program directors to support the effective delivery of programs and services.
* Ensure that operational processes align with programmatic goals and objectives.
* Assist in the evaluation and reporting of program outcomes.
* Provide stop-gap support until Progam Director role is hired.

**Knowledge & Skills**

* Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Non-Profit Management, or a related field (Master’s degree preferred).
* Minimum of 5-7 years of experience in operational management, preferably within a non-profit organization.
* Familiarity with non-profit regulations and best practices.
* Strong leadership and team management skills including effective communication and interpersonal skills.
* Proven experience in budgeting, resource allocation, and financial management.
* Excellent organizational and problem-solving abilities including the ability to think strategically, execute strategy, and bring ideas into reality.
* Experience with change management, including implementing new practices while bringing staff along.
* Situational leadership and a high degree of emotional intelligence.
* Proficient project management skills, capable of driving projects from inception to completion.
* Strong comprehension of related to racial disparities in Black infant and maternal health in the United States
* Comfortable in managing responsibilities within a hybrid work environment.
* Enthusiastic about embracing the uncertainties inherent in a startup environment, displaying flexibility and curiosity in approaching challenges as opportunities for learning.
* Ability and willingness to learn and flexibility when adapting to new technologies. Technical proficiency in Google Suite, Microsoft Office Suite, project management software, and database applications required.
* Supervisory experience required

**Personal Attributes**

* Passionate about the mission and goals of the Perinatal Health Equity Initiative.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Strong commitment to ethical practices and integrity.
* Adaptable and able to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
* Critically discerning as it pertains to communication and escalation of risks

**Expected Hours of Work**

Standard days and hours of work are Monday through Friday, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. EST. The Operations Director is expected to work 40 hours per work week with a minimum in-office commitment of 2 days per week.

**Travel**

Regular domestic travel of up to 15% is expected for organization site visits, meetings, and conferences.

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this role and scope. This job description will evolve to accommodate changing role requirements over time and the organization's growth.

**Compensation & Benefits**

* **Health and Wellness**: Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance plans to keep you and your family healthy.
* **Financial Security**: Competitive salary, retirement savings plans, and life insurance options to ensure your financial well-being.
* **Work-Life Balance**: Generous paid time off, including vacation days, holidays, and sick leave, as well as flexible work arrangements to help you maintain a healthy work-life balance.
* **Professional Development**: Opportunities for continuous learning and career advancement through professional development programs,and access to conferences and workshops.
* **Supportive Environment**: A collaborative and inclusive work culture that values transparency, autonomy, and ownership, providing a supportive environment where you can thrive.

**Anti-Discrimination Policy**

PHEI does not discriminate against applicants or employees because of race, gender,

ability, religious creed, national origin, marital status, age, or any other characteristic

protected under applicable federal or state law.

**Application Deadline**

We are accepting applications on a rolling basis and will continue to review submissions until the position is filled by the most qualified candidate. We encourage you to apply as soon as possible, as early applications will be given priority.

title: Landscaping Crew Leader
description:
Hudson Valley Landscape Design a Riverview Companies is looking for an experienced, highly qualified Landscape Senior Crew Leader to join our team. As a Senior Crew Leader, you will be responsible for leading and managing a team of landscapers in the installation, maintenance, and improvement of landscapes. You will be responsible for ensuring that all work is completed to the highest standards of quality and safety.

Our Company is a fast growing, leading landscaping and snow removal company in the Northeast U.S., and our Westchester branch is experiencing significant growth.

**Responsibilities:**

* Lead and manage a team of landscapers
* Plan and coordinate landscape mowing and projects
* Ensure that all work is completed to the highest standards of quality and safety
* Maintain accurate records of all work performed
* Maintain accurate crew time records
* Maintain and care for equipment
* Other duties as assigned

**Qualifications:**

* High school diploma or equivalent preferred
* 5+ years of experience in landscaping
* 2+ years of experience in snow removal
* Strong leadership and communication skills
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team
* Ability to lift and carry heavy objects
* Valid driver's license and clean driving record

If you are a highly motivated and experienced Landscape Crew Leader, we encourage you to apply!

title: Project Manager for Leading Custom Apparel Company
description:
All-County Apparel is looking for a Project Manager to join our team!

About us: All-County Apparel is a leading, full-service custom apparel and t-shirt company specializing in screen printing, embroidery, direct-to-garment (DTG) and custom online stores. We make ordering easy with our large product selection and experienced sales team. Specializing in high-volume production, we offer worldwide fulfillment capabilities and are proudly trusted by corporate clients and elite multi-location organizations. Our commitment to quality service has enabled us to grow into one of the largest custom apparel decorators on the East Coast.

Job description: Project Manager encompasses sales and graphic design skills to work directly with clients to create their quotes including generating pricing, selecting styles and editing artwork. Ideal canditiate is highly profiecient in Adobe Illustrator and has experience working directly with clients. Ideal candidate has experience in the custom apparel and/or promo industries.

Responsibilities:

* Preparing quotes and sales orders for clients
* Processing orders for clients
* Developing new client relationships from leads
* Communicating with production department when need-be
* Growing accounts to meet/exceed sales goals, offering existing clients new ideas
* Documenting activities in our CRM
* Assisting in other areas of business activity when needed
* Meet and exceed sales objectives

Perks:

* Room to advance
* Easygoing workplace, goal-oriented environment
* Computer provided (PC workstation)
* Flexible PTO
* Company Bonus
* Paid Holidays
* Competitive package

Canditiate must be/must have list:

* Proficient working with Adobe CS Illustrator and Photoshop
* Experience working with vector artwork
* Experience managing projects from start to finish
* Experience in sales position/ working directly with clients
* Strong communication skills (email and phone)

title: Dishwasher
description:
**Escape from the Every Day and Discover an Extraordinary Career Experience with Scratch Restaurants!**  

  

Sushi by Scratch Restaurants is expanding, with our newest location opening in the Flatiron District!  

  

We are looking for a responsible dishwasher who is interested in taking on a new challenge. Sushi by Scratch Restaurants is seeking a dish team who is capable of maintaining clean and dishes stocked and ready to go for our sushi chefs as well as complete prep duties to best serve our guests! The ideal candidates will assist the team with ensuring the materials needed for prep are cleaned, maintained, and organized and the prep lists are completed.
  

  

**Job Duties:**  

Cleaning, washing all dishes and materials for sushi chefs, ensure all areas are clean and ready for guests. Be able to be adaptive in a small fine dining environment. Hand washing fragile dishware. This position requires professionalism of the highest degree as all work is completed in front of guests. Handwashing is a must as our dishes are specifically curated for our menu. The ideal candidate will be able to work quickly, efficiently, and with diligence. Maintain an organized area at all times. Assist chefs with prep duties using all proper tools and food safety standards.  

  

With multiple operating outlets, and more on the way, this is a great opportunity for dishwashers to join a team primed for growth!  

  

**Positions Available:**  

Part Time

title: Qualcomm Brand Advocate
description:
Earn weekly pay with BDS! Do you enjoy introducing people to new technologies and influencing their buying decisions? As a Brand Advocate, you will demonstrate and sell computing devices with Qualcomm processors inside at your assigned retail location. You must have the ability to quickly learn about technology products, have a knack for retail sales, and be comfortable training and interacting with consumers and retail sales associates. This is a part-time opportunity working 6-hour shifts each Saturday and Sunday. Join our team as we bring technology to life!

**WHAT WE OFFER**

* Competitive pay starting at $19.00/hour plus bonus opportunities
* Weekly pay and early wage access - get paid when you need it
* 401(k) with employer match
* Paid sick time
* Paid training
* Employee assistance program
* Employee discounts
* Referral bonus
* Opportunity to work with a growing company that actively rewards and promotes its employees

**WHAT YOU’LL DO**

* Achieve KPIs and strive to consistently meet sales goals and program objectives
* Convert product benefits to sales - fully understand the features and benefits of Qualcomm products including hardware and accessories.
* Increase consumer sales through proactive engagement and demonstrations
* Build long-lasting partnerships and relationships with store personnel
* Engage, educate retail sales associates, and create excitement to increase the rate of recommendation
* Perform day-to-day operations, including but not limited to merchandising and maintaining our interactive displays and verifying in-store promotional and marketing material
* Gather, summarize, and report via our reporting tool daily on field and channel feedback and activities, as well as inform the team of competitive insights
* Periodically coordinate and execute special awareness and sales events
* Display a professional demeanor while representing Qualcomm and BDS Connected Solutions

**WHAT YOU’LL BRING**

**Experience and Education:**

* High School Diploma or equivalent
* Background in consumer electronics and the retail environment
* Experience in sales and/or customer-facing experience at retail

**Skills and Attributes:**

* Strong interest in technology and the ability to quickly learn new products and features
* Self-starter with a strong commitment to driving results
* Must be enthusiastic, initiative-taking, have an outgoing personality, and be comfortable in a competitive environment
* High level of initiative with a continued drive to learn
* Strong sales negotiation skills
* Professional demeanor, excellent verbal, and written communication skills
* Organized and detail-oriented
* Strong problem-solving and customer service skills
* Availability to work on the weekends
* Access to either an iPhone or Android smartphone

**Physical Requirements:**

* The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is required to:
* Regularly sit, stand, walk, bend over, grasp, talk and/or hear, and drive
* Occasionally lift and carry up to 20 pounds
* Continuous hand/eye coordination and fine manipulation

We will consider for employment all qualified Applicants, including those with Criminal Histories, in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable state and local laws, including the City of Los Angeles’ Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

BDS Connected Solutions. (“BDS”) is an equal opportunity employer in every aspect of employment, including but not limited to; selection, training, development and promotion of the most qualified candidates and employees without regard to their race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, citizenship status, veteran status, or any other characteristic prohibited by state or local law. BDS is committed to equal employment opportunity in all other privileges, terms and conditions of employment that may not be covered in this statement. BDS is an at-will employer.

BDS Connected Solutions offers a complete suite of Connected Commerce solutions that blend Advocacy, Training, Retail, Virtual, Experiential, and Digital environments to influence the modern buyer, regardless of where they are on their shopping journey. Since 1985, BDS has been inspired by innovation; as we continue to evolve as a trendsetter in today’s disruptive market, we enable our clients to do the same. Our industry-leading experts never stop working to discover, design, and deploy custom buying solutions that empower brands to achieve and exceed their unique sales goals. BDS is headquartered in Irvine, California with a regional office in New York City, New York. Visit us at www.BDSsolutions.comfor more information.

* Flexible scheduling
* Positive/fun environment
* Networking opportunities

title: FULL TIME MEDICAL INSTRUCTOR
description:
For more than thirty years, MedAire has delivered the best possible remote medical, security, and operational support to clients in the air, on land, and at sea.

MedAire provides medical and security training courses to help crew and passengers mitigate their exposure to risks. Courses include student participation, hands-on exercises, skill evaluation, and a suite of audio and visual tools to reinforce key topics. Training leverages the best-in-class assistance platform, MedAire's MedLink, MedAire's Trip Ready, and aircraft medical equipment.

**Overall Purpose Of The Job** 

Delivers MedAire developed training programs as directed by Education Services.

**Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities**

* Delivers MedAire developed training courses to clients as directed by Education Services; provides instructional support as directed.
* Participates and assists with planning, implementation and conducting of Education Services’ Instructor Orientation Program.
* Actively participates in and contributes to company and department quality initiatives and activities.
* Represents the Company at conferences or seminars as requested.
* Measures and reports to ensure the effectiveness of instruction. Tests and evaluates students' progress, using written and performance tests and oral interviews where dictated.
* Responsible for timely completion of assigned projects, communication, and documentation to supervisor.
* Provides input as a subject matter expert as required.
* As needed, assist with the development of medical curriculum and/or coordination of special event training.
* As needed, provide support to administrative staff with special projects or assigned tasks.
* Maintain all client information that may be encountered either directly or indirectly while in the performance of the job in strict confidence in accordance with HIPAA and/or any other pertinent confidentiality regulations.

**Experience Required:**

* Aviation-Focused Instructors: 5 years clinical experience in flight nursing or flight paramedics or equivalent experience as an RN or EMT-P with demonstrated knowledge of aviation physiology.
* Maritime-Focused Instructors: Previous critical care or ER preferred, preferred experience in the maritime environment, including employment onboard a private or commercial vessel, or equivalent experience, such as training in STCW requirements, clinical training in wound care, including suturing.
* 5 years adult medical educator experience.

**Required Qualifications**

* Current unrestricted license as an RN or EMT-P.
* Current American Heart Association BLS Instructor or Heart Saver Instructor certification

**Travel/Rotation Requirements**

* Must possess a valid driver’s license and passport.
* Must be able to provide proof of adequate insurance coverage as defined by the state of residence.
* Must have or be able to obtain a valid credit card.
* Must be able to travel by air domestically and internationally. Must reside within 60 miles of a major/international airport.

*International SOS is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against employees or job applicants on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws.*

description:

**Position**: Waiter/Waitress

**Overview**:  

As a Server at Four Leaves, you are not just a part of our team; you are the ambassador of our brand, the face of our hospitality, and the guide for our guests through a journey of culinary delight. Your role is pivotal in creating an ambiance that echoes our commitment to exceptional dining experiences.  

  

**Key Responsibilities**:  

* **Guest Engagement**: Provide guests with a warm welcome, assist them in making informed food and beverage selections, and offer recommendations that align with their preferences.
* **Efficient Service**: Present food and beverage orders in a timely and professional manner, ensuring accuracy and attention to detail.
* **Dining Ambiance**: Contribute to a pleasant dining atmosphere through attentive service, engaging interactions, and a keen eye for the dining environment.
* **Operational Support**: Work collaboratively with the kitchen and bar staff to ensure a seamless dining experience for guests.
* **Quality Assurance**: Ensure that each guest’s experience meets our high standards of quality and service.

**Qualifications**:  

* Experience in a serving role, preferably in a similar dining environment.
* Excellent communication skills and a friendly, outgoing personality.
* Ability to work efficiently in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple tables.
* Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.

Join our team at Four Leaves, where your role as a Server goes beyond the conventional – it's about creating lasting memories for our guests through impeccable service and a genuine love for hospitality.

title: Mixologist
description:
**Benefits:**  

* Dynamic, Respectful, and Sociable Working Environment
* Competitive Compensation
* Training & development

  

**Position**: Mixologist  

**Reports to**: Assistant Manager  

  

**Overview**:  

 As a Bartender at Four Leaves, you are not just mixing drinks; you are the architect of our guests' beverage experience. In this role, you are the charismatic creator of cocktails, the sage of spirits, and the personification of our establishment's vibrant energy. Here, you'll be more than a bartender; you'll be a key player in an extraordinary team, crafting not just drinks, but memories.  

  

**Key Responsibilities**:  

* **Crafting Masterpieces**: Mix and serve drinks with style and precision, crafting each cocktail as a work of art. Your skill and creativity set the standard for our exceptional beverage offerings.
* **Engaging Storyteller**: Engage with guests, share your knowledge of spirits and mixology, and become part of their story. Your interaction can turn a simple night out into an unforgettable experience.
* **Ambiance Creator**: Contribute to an atmosphere that’s both electrifying and welcoming. Your presence behind the bar helps set the mood for the entire tavern.
* **Quality and Innovation**: Stay abreast of the latest trends in mixology and contribute ideas to evolve our drink menu, keeping Four Leaves at the forefront of the beverage scene.
* **Operational Efficiency**: Work seamlessly with the Bar Manager and fellow team members to ensure a smooth, efficient bar operation. This includes inventory management, cleanliness, and compliance with safety standards.

**Qualifications**:  

* Experience in bartending, with a proven track record of exceptional drink service.
* A vibrant personality that resonates with guests and team members alike.
* Excellent communication skills and a genuine passion for engaging with people.
* A creative mind, with a willingness to experiment and innovate in mixology.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, managing multiple tasks with grace.


  

At Four Leaves, being a bartender means being part of a story that's told one drink at a time. Your role goes beyond serving beverages; it's about creating an environment where every guest feels special and every visit is memorable.

title: Mosquito Technician
description:
**Only MENTALLY TOUGH, very hardworking, polite, composed & respectful people with integrity wanted!**

**This job is only for people who really want to work hard & be fairly compensated!**

**You will be reporting to the Main Hub in Morganville, NJ.**

**Must have PHYSICAL and MENTAL ENDURANCE\\*\\*\\***

**Must be a SAFE and Excellent DRIVER\\*\\*\\***

**Must be savvy with your smartphone and able to efficiently, effectively and respectfully communicate with customers, peers and superiors at all times in a safe manner\\*\\*\\***

**Veteran Friendly\\***

**\\*\\*\\***We only want **POSITIVE VIBES** & people.**\\*\\*\\***

**Bite Back** is Hiring Tick & Mosquito Control Technicians for the 2024 Season

Get rid of the respirator and unhealthy chemicals!

**Must be able to work the full season from April - October.**

**THIS IS NOT AN ORDINARY TICK & MOSQUITO CONTROL COMPANY - PLEASE READ\\*\\*\\***

Are you passionate about making a difference in the lives of people, pets and the environment? Are you looking for a work environment where you can use your **friendly attitude, skills, determination** and **hard work** to be **rewarded**? If you said yes, then **Bite Back Tick & Mosquito Control** is the place for you!

**Bite Back Tick & Mosquito Control** is the *leading* All Natural Tick & Mosquito company in NJ. Our environmentally friendly solutions are safe for people, pets and the environment, so you don't have to wear a respirator or any other PPE. We are passionate about providing quality solutions and making the world a better place, one less bug bite at a time!

At **Bite Back Tick & Mosquito Control**, we want to make sure our employees are treated right and rewarded for bringing their skills and passion to work each day. We value hard work and dedication, and recognize that each team member contributes to our success.

Unlike many other pest control companies, you will be well taken care of when you join our team. You can look forward to being part of a professional and pleasant work environment with great benefits, competitive wages, and the opportunity for real growth.

If you have a passion for making the world a better place and believe that you are the right person for the job, then come join us here at **Bite Back Tick & Mosquito Control!** Help us **bite back** against ticks, mosquitos & unethical competition while creating a real difference in our community, and the world.

**About Bite Back**

At **Bite Back** we treat our clients and colleagues like family. **Bite Back Tick and Mosquito** is **The** **Only Trailblazing All Natural Tick and Mosquito control company in New Jersey**. We are truly pioneering something that has never been done before and setting the **Gold Standard** for how it should be done. Our natural solutions are groundbreaking, as they take a unique and unprecedented approach to tackling the problem of unwanted Ticks and Mosquitoes. We provide truly safe and effective outdoor tick & mosquito control services to our residential and commercial customers, eliminating and repelling Ticks & Mosquitos. We are seeking friendly and dedicated Pest Control Technicians in the area. If you are looking for flexible hours with lots of opportunities to move up and grow within the fastest growing pest control company in New Jersey, we want to meet with you! We are locally operated and treat all our employees like family.

**Primary Job Tasks and Responsibilities**

* Must be **respectful,** **friendly, competent,** **reliable** & **professional.\\*\\*\\*\\*\\***
* Quickly become knowledgable about **Bite Back's services** and questions relating to **Bite Back** that a client may ask.
* Ability and willing to do job as needed and accept requests from both management and customers
* **Make sure the gate(s) you came through are all closed and locked on your way into the property and out.**
* **Must be compliant to superiors instructions, requests and company policy.**
* Must be **teamwork oriented** and **professionally and promptly communicate** with **superiors**, **coworkers** and **clients** at **all times**.
* Must be **considerate**, **respectful** and **friendly** to **all clients**.
* Ensure **clients** are **satisfied**.
* **No selling**.
* Field technicians provide outdoor pest control service to client's yards.
* Visually inspect and treat for Ticks & Mosquitoes.
* Apply **Bite Back's All Natural** **spray and granular**.
* **Communicate** to the **client** the **service** **expectations**, **procedures** and **make** **recommendations** for **reducing** **Tick & Mosquito activity**.
* **Work outdoors** during **warm conditions** for **long periods of time**.
* The ability to carry a 60-pound back pack sprayer for long periods of time through wooded or uneven terrain.
* **Safely drive company vehicles** at **all times**. **No aggressive driving\\***
* Keep a **clean** and **well-organized service vehicle**.
* Must have a valid Driver's License.\\*
* Must have a **working smartphone** and charging cable.\\*\\*\\*
* Other duties as needed.

**Education and Experience**

* Relevant experience is a PLUS, but no formal education required. **Bite Back** will provide training.
* Read, write and speak English proficiently.
* Able to calculate liquid measurement.

**Key Competencies**

* **Exceptional client service skills.(Polite, Professional, Courteous, NO Attitude.)\\***
* Must be **drug free**.
* Self-confident.
* Professional.
* Detail oriented.
* **Reliable**.
* **Able to work with others and have fun in the process!**

**Working conditions**

* This is a part-time position Monday to Sunday (Morning/Afternoon Shift). Hours will depend on the season and may change as operational needs dictate.
* This position requires the employee to work outdoors and handle safe natural pesticides during the warm summer months. The technician will also be required to use and carry a 60-pound backpack while wearing comfortable **Bite Back** attire.

**Perks**

* Professional, High-Performance High-Reward Environment
* Work outdoors
* Paid training
* Air-Conditioned trucks
* Only working with safe, natural pesticides

**Compensation and Benefits**

* Hourly pay: You will have an hourly pay of $20.00-$25.00
* Get paid for all your positive customer reviews (extra on top of your regular pay)
* Lots of upward mobility to move up to a larger role (we like to train and hire from within)
* Ongoing skills training to help you grow and improve both professionally and personally. *If you are a friendly and hard-working individual, you will thrive in this environment. If this sounds like it could be a good fit for you, please apply. We look forward to hearing from you!*

**Requirements and Qualifications:**

* Valid New Jersey driver’s license.
* Must be physically fit in order to carry a 60 lb. spray back on your back and work in the summer heat.
* Smart Phone capable mobile device.
* Customer service oriented with positive attitude.
* Ability to work as a **Team Player**.
* Self-motivated, reliable and prompt, must be able to work alone efficiently.
* **Strong attention to detail**.
* **Professional communication** skills and **appearance** are a must.
* **Problem solving** and **time management** skills are **necessary**.
* Ability to work in extreme heat conditions (5-8 hours per day).
* Ability to work Saturdays and Sundays.
* High school diploma or equivalent preferred.
* **Website:** https://bitebacktick.com

title: Inventory Management Specialist
description:
**Job Title: Inventory Management Specialist**

**Company:** Funny Face Bakery

**Job Type:** Part Time (14-16 hrs)

* **About Funny Face Bakery:**

At Funny Face Bakery, we're not just about baking cookies; we're about creating smiles. With a commitment to quality ingredients and playful innovation, we've become a beloved destination for cookie lovers everywhere. As we continue to grow, we're seeking an Inventory Management Specialist to join our team and ensure that our delicious treats are always available when our customers crave them most.

* **Job Description:**

Funny Face Bakery is seeking a proactive and detail-oriented Inventory Management Specialist to enhance our inventory system and optimize our operations. From monitoring sales trends to forecasting inventory needs, the ideal candidate will play a pivotal role in ensuring the smooth flow of our baked goods from production to storefronts.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Regularly monitor sales data and inventory levels to anticipate demand and adjust stock levels accordingly.
* Coordinate with storefront teams and production to ensure accurate inventory counts and timely replenishment.
* Transfer holiday-specific products from online inventory to storefronts based on shipping deadlines.
* Plan and prepare for upcoming holidays by forecasting inventory needs and coordinating production schedules four weeks in advance.
* Analyze past sales data to make informed projections and adjustments to inventory quantities.
* Weekly check-ins on slack with managers on inventory updates
* Maintain accurate records of online inventory and facilitate the distribution of products for storefront deliveries.
* Identify underperforming products and recommend strategies for discontinuation or adjustment of batch sizes.
* Take initiative to restock or increase quantities of popular items to meet customer demand.
* Determine optimal distribution of inventory among different store locations based on sales trends and customer demographics.
* Develop and implement a system for efficient production lead times, considering seasonal fluctuations and peak demand periods.

**Qualifications:**

* Proven experience in inventory management, preferably in a retail or food industry setting.
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret sales data and trends to make informed decisions.
* Familiarity with inventory forecasting techniques, including consideration of holidays and social trends.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
* Detail-oriented and highly organized, with the ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities simultaneously.
* Proficiency in inventory management software and Microsoft Excel.
* Ability to work autonomously and take initiative to solve problems and drive

**Funny Face Bakery Inventory Specialist & Pop Culture EnthusiastLocation:** 160 Water Street, Brooklyn, NY 11201**Job Type:** Part-time (12-16 hours per week)**Schedule:** Likely Monday, Wednesday, and Friday, but flexible based on availability

**About Us:**

Funny Face Bakery is a creative bakery specializing in beautifully decorated pop culture cookies that bring joy to every occasion. We pride ourselves on our attention to detail, quality ingredients, and innovative designs that delight our customers. As we continue to grow, we're looking for a dedicated Inventory Specialist & Pop Culture Enthusiast to join our team and establish a brand-new inventory management system from the ground up.

**Position Overview:**

The Decorated Cookie Inventory Specialist is responsible for creating and managing our inventory of decorated and Gooey Cookies, ensuring all store locations are properly stocked, and orders are fulfilled with precision. This is a first-time project, requiring someone who is self-motivated, highly organized, and capable of designing and implementing an efficient inventory system from scratch. The ideal candidate is a problem-solver who thrives on challenges and is passionate about beautifully crafted cookies.

**This position starts as part-time (12-16 hours per week) with the potential to transition to full-time. The likely schedule is Monday, Wednesday, and Friday, but we are flexible and can adjust based on your availability.**

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Develop and implement a new inventory management system** for decorated cookies, ensuring products are stored properly and accurately.
* Track inventory levels, reporting any shortages or surpluses to the production team.
* Coordinate with the baking, storefront and decorating teams to ensure a seamless flow of products from production to sales.
* Using an Inventory Integration app, maintain accurate records of all inventory transactions, including detailed documentation of any issues or discrepancies.
* Assist in developing and implementing inventory management procedures and systems.
* Collaborate with sales and customer service teams to ensure timely and accurate order fulfillment.
* Conduct regular inventory audits to ensure accuracy and prevent loss or waste.
* **Conduct post-mortems and strategy planning sessions** after major selling periods (e.g., holidays) and present findings and recommendations to leadership.
* **Develop and present inventory strategy plans** to leadership before key selling periods such as holidays and seasonal events.
* Support the production team during peak seasons or large orders as needed.
* **Understand and anticipate selling holidays** (e.g., Christmas, Hanukkah, Mother’s Day, wedding season) as well as less obvious moments like baseball season and zodiac signs, to effectively align our inventory schedule.

**Qualifications:**

* A passion for pop culture and cookies is a must!
* Proficient in Google Sheets for tracking and managing inventory data.
* Previous experience in inventory management, preferably in a food or bakery environment.
* Strong organizational skills with a meticulous attention to detail.
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment while maintaining accuracy.
* Excellent communication and teamwork skills.
* Familiarity with inventory management software or the ability to quickly learn new systems.
* A good understanding of seasonal and event-based inventory demands.

**How to Apply:**

If you’re organized, detail-oriented, and have a passion for cookies and pop culture, we’d love to hear from you!

**Schedule:** Monday, Wednesday, and Friday, but flexible**Experience:** 1 year of inventory control preferred**Work Location:** In-person, Brooklyn, NY 11201**Ability to Commute/Relocate:** Must be able to commute to or relocate to Brooklyn, NY 11201 before starting work.

GOALS

**Identify Poorly Selling Products:** Determine criteria for discontinuing products that aren’t selling well.

* Use Inventory management Shopify Integration
* Discuss with storefront staff with regular meetings and active communication to contribute qualitative feedback from customers

**Optimize Batch Sizes:** Decide when to increase or decrease batch sizes based on demand.

* Understanding and monitoring the Sell-Through-Rate of our constant cookies and our holiday cookies

**Restock Popular Cookies:** Establish indicators for restocking cookies that are selling well.

**Distribute Inventory Effectively:** Develop a strategy to allocate more or less inventory to specific locations based on sales data.

**Determine Production Lead Time:** Find the “sweet spot” for how long it takes to produce new batches (minimum and maximum lead time) and understand how it varies during busy times, such as Q4.

**Overarching Goal:** Gain basic knowledge of inventory forecasting, including:

* Planning for holidays and social trends
* Adjusting inventory movement based on shipping times
* Favoring online quantity for holidays with specific buying patterns (aka not letting fathers day/mother’s day sold out online until close to the holiday weekend because customers tend to not buy these cookies in advance in person but will plan to ship them)

description:

title: Digital Channels Lead Marketing Strategist
description:
The Digital Channels Strategy and Optimization Strategist leads the function which manages Wells Fargo's valuable marketing inventory across its owned digital media channels. This includes the public website, the online banking website, the mobile app. These channels regularly engage tens of millions of customers and serve as a crucial touchpoint for prospects. They are an engine for Wells Fargo to grow and deepen customer relationships, enhance customer experience, and strengthen the brand.  

  

The Owned Media Channels Strategy and Revenue Optimization group is part of the Enterprise Marketing Services organization within the Consumer Lending business. While it sits within Consumer Lending organization, this group supports all consumer lines of business including the Consumer and Small Business Banking group, Wealth & Investment Management, and Brand Marketing. The Enterprise Marketing Services organization has several enterprise centers of excellence (COE) for marketing, and this group is one of them.  

  

This high-profile role is responsible for a) optimizing marketing campaigns in our digital channels, b) leading channel strategy and governance, and c) continually increasing channel effectiveness via the application of new capabilities and strategies. They are a digital marketing tech and data savvy group. They partner closely with the line of business marketing teams and other COEs including Marketing Execution, Marketing Technology Platforms, Marketing Channel Analytics, the In-House Creative Agency, and Digital Customer Experience.  

  

This is an exciting and transformative time for Wells Fargo marketing due to the extensive investment in and deployment of next generation marketing platforms. We are achieving new heights in omni-channel personalization, 360 customer data, and highly competitive customer experiences. You will be a leader in a new chapter of Wells Fargo marketing fueled by modernized technology, data access, and analytics resources.  

  

**In this role, you will:**  

  

Wells Fargo is seeking a Lead Marketing Consultant to support our marketing team within. The Marketing organization develops marketing strategies and delivers marketing campaigns that support business objectives. This organization operates with a customer-first approach rooted in customer analytics, continuous test and learn and ongoing consumer research. We strive to meet customers where they are in their borrowing journey and communicate with them with relevant messaging in their preferred channel. The Marketing Channel Strategy & Revenue Optimization center of excellence maximizes the revenue of Wells Fargo's marketing channels while curating best-in-class experiences for customers. The team estimates that Wells Fargo's owned marketing channels are poised for hundreds of millions of dollars in incremental revenue over the next 18 months from just a modest gain in customer engagement leading to conversion rate. A large driver of that opportunity will come from fine-tuning the selection of the most-relevant and most-valuable targeted messages we put in front of customers and prospects who come to Wells Fargo's channels.
  

  

**Drive channel strategy and governance to maximize the impact of our marketing channels as enterprise assets*** Lead the implementation of a strategic vision of personalized marketing at scale. Translate strategic vision into tangible strategic marketing programs, including generating recommendations for segmentation and messaging optimizations to increase personalization. Strive to continuously improve the customer journey and develop dynamic marketing across a range of products and services while evangelizing best practices.
* Operate enterprise-wide audience management, targeting, creative strategy, and personalization platforms.
* Enhance, gain alignment on, and implement data-driven channel strategies including placement rules, arbitration logic, contact frequency, etc.
* Oversee cross-LOB campaign monitoring and prioritization through historical and scenario analysis.

**Advance channel effectiveness via the deployment of new capabilities for targeting, personalization, customer experience, and measurement/analytics*** Provide planning, requirements, and expert consultation for new platforms, experiences, and methodologies.
* Lead the adoption of new capabilities via pilots and roll outs with multi-disciplinary teams.
* Measure impacts of new platforms and experiences on customer and business outcomes and identify areas of optimization.
* Support change management initiatives to socialize and train marketers on new requirements and processes related to channels capabilities enhancements.

**Provide thought leadership to marketing and non-marketing stakeholders*** Educate stakeholders on the customer and business value of the channels and socialize strategic plans.
* Drive impact as an independent thought leader in defining, analyzing, and solving highly complex, interdependent problems, and will do so in a collaborative context with both internal upstream and downstream internal partners, as well as executive management.
* Champion one-to-one marketing, customer centricity, enterprise governance, and AI solutions as the underpinning of successful marketing across businesses and channels.
* Build and implement new routines and procedures needed to drive business outcomes and achieve target operating model, resulting in incremental marketing financial contribution through growth in personalization.
* Successfully navigate a matrixed organization leading complex, cross-functional initiatives with a high degree of autonomy.

The Candidate
  

  

The successful candidate will demonstrate leadership and credibility with a proven ability to influence broadly across a matrixed organization, create engagement, and drive results. This role will be a strong communicator and have robust interpersonal effectiveness with an impeccable reputation for integrity, accuracy, consistency, and business acumen.  

  

**Required Qualifications*** 5+ of Marketing, Digital Marketing, Digital Platforms (i.e. Mobile) experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education.

**Desired Qualifications*** 5+ years of experience in marketing channel management, optimization, and analytics.
* Experience in financial services, especially banking.
* Experience managing teams who use advanced, enterprise-scale digital marketing technologies such as predictive analytics decision engines, Data Management Platforms, Customer Data Platforms, Dynamic Creative Optimization tools, Multi-Channel Attribution, etc.
* Highly analytical and understands concepts related to predictive modeling, AI, data science, analytics, simulation, and forecasting.
* Experience in personalization and journeys in multi-channel environments (online, mobile, email, call centers, brick-and-mortar)
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability to present complex concepts into simplified solutions in a straightforward and understandable manner to multiple stakeholders, including senior leaders. Proven success achieving objectives requiring a high level of cooperation from cross-functional partners in other teams.
* Demonstrated ability to deliver incremental business profit via marketing and to think critically about the next best opportunity.
* A "building" (entrepreneurial) mentality, comfortable navigating ambiguity and creating a pioneering playbook for others to follow rather than following rote steps.
* Persuasive storytelling skills - ability to synthesize multi-dimensional, complex, and interrelated concepts and effectively communicate actions and outcomes.
* Understanding of growth and loyalty marketing principles and marketing technology trends.
* Candidate will be data-driven, growth-oriented, collaborative and innovative, forward looking, and customer-centric.

**Job Expectations:*** Work on-site at stated locations on the job opening.
* This position offers a hybrid work schedule.
* This position is not eligible for Visa sponsorship.
* No relocation assistance

title: Bartender- $10.65/hr + tips ($700-$900 weekly)
description:
Overview

As the primary contact with guests at the bar, the Bartender is responsible for selling, preparing and serving mixed beverages, wine and food. Duties include preparing and serving beverages, overseeing bar maintenance, making menu suggestions, delivering food and drinks, describing the dishes to guests, recommending wine selections, monitoring guest satisfaction, and managing inventory. Must be pleasant, conscientious, and professional with an extensive knowledge of mixology, product, and alcoholic beverage selections. Must be able to operate effectively as part of a team, communicate clearly, and ensure smooth service operations and quality service.

Responsibilities

* Understand and perform job duties to the expectations of TableOne Hospitality's Service, Food, Beverage, and Wine manuals.
* Executes and facilitates service in cooperation with other Bartenders, sommeliers, and managers.
* Takes and makes beverage orders in an accurate and timely manner.
* Welcomes all guests and ensure guests receive responsive, professional, and gracious service at all times.
* Answers any questions about the menu, specific food items, the wine list or any other inquiries the guest may have.
* Liaises with server to ensure communication at all times about wants and needs of guests.
* Understands any changes in the menu, dietary restrictions, food allergies, etc.
* Maintains a clean, safe environment all times in the bar (front bar, back bar, well, floor).
* Fully understands and complies with all federal, state, county and municipal regulations that pertain to health, safety, and when serving alcohol.

Qualifications

* 3+ years of fine dining mixology experience.
* Knowledge of service and food and beverage, generally involving at least 3 years of dining room experience and thorough knowledge of fine dining, service procedures, and functions.
* Cleanliness, organization, and the ability to work well in a team situation are crucial to this position.
* Extensive food and wine knowledge
* Must be of minimum age to serve alcohol.
* Applicants must possess a strong dedication towards learning, and motivation to progress in a fine dining environment.
* Possess excellent basic math skills and have the ability to operate a point of sale system and Microsoft based computer systems.
* Familiarity with Microsoft Office Suite of products and strong financial acumen.
* Must be impeccably groomed, maintain good hygiene, good posture, and have required uniform and tools.
* Responsive to constructive feedback from Management.

title: New Coffee Shop Opening - Woodbury Common Outlets
description:
**About Blank Street…**

Baristas at Blank Street must be able to work independently, while also thriving in a team environment. The right person for this role is a proven people-person, taking pride in giving amazing service experiences. You are customer centric and believe in serving a carefully curated menu with passion and precision, making every effort to give your customers exactly what they need, every day, in their way. This role is based out of the new store located at the Woodbury Common Premium Outlets in Woodbury, New York (Orange County).

**Our Values**

* **Magic is in the Details:** We value attention to detail in everything we do. We're always thinking about the small things that make a moment meaningful.
* **Move as One:** We value people who strive to be the best team player, not individual stars.
* **“My Home is your Home” Hospitality:** We look for individuals who treat others the same way they'd treat a guest in their home. We care about presentation, hospitality, and having fun even when things are stressful.

**Who you are:**

* A friendly and enthusiastic team player with a passion for excellent customer service; you’re always ready to make your customers’ day
* A reliable employee who is able to effectively manage time and priorities, including during busy rush periods where a sense of urgency is necessary
* Passionate about creating delicious coffee and other cafe beverages
* A strong independent problem solver with proven multi-tasking and communication skills
* Someone who is curious, adaptable and always willing to learn
* Comfortable working in a team or independently
* Comfortable with cash-handling and maintaining store safety

**What you'll own:**

* Delight our customers with consistent, welcoming and engaging customer service, taking the opportunity to turn every customer into a regular
* Work within a world-class coffee program using the best coffee equipment (the eversys cameos and shotmasters) and product in the industry to prepare the tastiest drinks
* Complete all training to ensures proper measures are in place to achieve the correct handling of food and beverage to retain its freshness and quality
* Have systems in place to avoid wastage of product with both food and beverage, following and adjusting par levels where needed in line with business peaks and lows
* Maintains NYS Department of Health and Mental Hygiene (DOH) standards at all times
* Full and complete knowledge and adherence to all product, service and brand training playbooks
* Participates in all initiatives with the Operations and marketing teams to increase foot traffic, new customers, daily sales, and operational profitability and develop a loyal neighborhood customer base

**Requirements:**

* Experience in the customer service or hospitality industry
* 18+ years of age
* Able to lift 25+ lbs, and to stand for long periods of time
* Availability that meets the needs of our cafes
* Part Time: less than 30 hours per week, 3 days per week. You must be able to work 2 peak days (Friday, Saturday, and/or Sunday)
* Full Time: 30 or more hours per week, 4-5 days per week. You must be able to work 2 peak days (Friday, Saturday, and/or Sunday)
* Weekend and holiday availability preferred
* You must be authorized to work in the U.S.: upon acceptance of a job offer and completion of the Form I-9 with acceptable documents, Blank Street will provide the federal government with employees’ Form I-9 information to confirm authorization to work in the U.S. (a process known as ”E-Verify”).

**Perks:**

* $16.50-$17.50/ hour starting + tips
* Barista accreditation/ training program
* Paid sick time
* PTO time
* Health benefits based on eligibility
* As a growing company we have opportunities for advancement for those interested

title: Children's Ballet Teacher
description:
Tutu School Dumbo is a brand new Tutu School location, opening this Fall in late September/early October and we are looking for 2-3 children's ballet teachers to join our opening team!

We look for teachers that want to invest in their students and commit to at least 6 months, (but ideally a one year commitment). Tutu School is a quaint boutique ballet school that provides a creative dance education experience for children from 18 months to 8 years old. It is a place where students are urged to fully exercise their imaginations as well as their bodies, and where we not only focus on teaching children age-appropriate motor skills and the fundamental principles of ballet, but also expose them to the world of classical music and the enchanting stories of famous ballets.

Applicants must have experience working with children and a background in dance (strong ballet skills are a requirement). Please view the teacher responsibilities as well as the estimated working hours below! If you are interested, please submit an inquiry with your resume that includes your dance history and child care experience, as well as your availability starting now for training. Please only reach out to us if you are passionate about teaching the love and magic of ballet to children!

Teachers’ responsibilities to students

* Acting as a mentor or role model
* Providing a safe environment—physical, emotional, and psychological
* Showing respect for all students through a fair and equitable distribution of time
* the use of encouraging language in offering positive reinforcement, constructive criticism, and acknowledgment of achievements
* Offering challenges that will raise them to the next level
* Explain and demonstrate proper techniques
* Ability to connect and capture students’ attention, deliver information clearly, concisely and effectively
* Encouraging them to progress to next level through constructive feedback and “report cards”
* Making everyone, regardless of ability level, feel included

Teachers’ responsibilities to Tutu School

* Understand and adopt the Tutu School curriculum
* Understand and utilize the library of music offered for classes
* Have a high level understanding for the class objectives in all Tutu School levels both personally and professionally
* Attend and assist at Bravo Bash (bi-yearly student dance recitals)
* Attend staff meetings
* Effective and timely communication in person and through email with varied school coordinators, studio managers and colleagues (for sub requests, parent feedback, etc)

Expected Hours

We are building our class schedule now and are are looking to fill shifts Wednesday-Friday mornings from 8:45am - 12:30pm, Monday-Friday afternoons from 3:15-6:30pm, and Saturday and Sunday from 8:30am-1:30pm. In your response to our posting, please let us know your availability during those times.

Vacation Days

While we do not have any paid vacation days, Tutu School observes 5 weeks during the year where we close for breaks. Those include Spring Break (based on the local school schedule usually in March or April), Summer Break (4th of July week), Thanksgiving Break (the week of Thanksgiving) and Winter Break (2 weeks over the winter holidays and New Years). Teachers are asked to take vacations during those times.

Compensation

Compensation is based on experience, and ranges from $25 - $35 per hour for teaching (training and admin are paid at a different rate of $16/hour). Teachers will have the opportunity to earn bonuses based on trial class sign ups!

title: Event Operations Assistant
description:
**Job Summary:** The Assistant Operations/Event Services will oversee & when needed manually set-up, break down, and service all meeting and event space in accordance with service standards.

***Qualifications***

Education & Experience:

* Experience in a catering, event or hotel related field preferred.

* Performs all job duties and responsibilities in an honest and ethical manner and incompliance with all laws, regulations, and Company policies.

Duties & Functions

* Understand guest needs and set up requirements.
* Maintain professional attire and personal hygiene.
* Ability to prioritize, organize and follow through
* Ability to adhere to timeliness in completion of set-ups

* Maintain cleanliness and organization of work areas throughout shift

title: LSW, LCSW, LPC, LMFT Psychotherapist for Queer I Team
description:
Want to join a collaborative team and work with clients you'll love? Resolution Counseling Center is a growing private practice in the heart of Journal Square in Jersey City. Our JC Wellness team and Queer I team is currently hiring.

We are looking for therapists who love to work with adults and who are open to working with couples, or kids and teens, or all four! We prefer to hire candidates with experience working full-time as a therapist, but you don't need to have worked with couples or youth before. We provide substantial onsite training depending on your interests–usually in working with the LGBTQIA population, CBT, Play Therapy, or Perinatal Mental Health as well as other modalities and interventions. Paid group supervision is provided for all full time psychotherapist staff regardless of licensure.

Full time, hybrid-work position: onsite 2 days/wk and work-from-home 3 days/wk.

Job Requirements:

* Master's Degree in Psychology, Social Work, Counseling, or Marriage/Family Therapy
* Current New Jersey license as LSW, LCSW, LPC, or LMFT
* Ability to work in the office two days a week (one being a weekend)
* Available to work two evening shifts (until 8pm)

Preferential Consideration:

* 2+ years of full-time counseling experience (i.e. 3000 session hours)
* Experience with couples, postpartum moms and dads, or infertility issues.
* Therapists who have special expertise to offer LGBTQ clients and clients of color are particularly encouraged to apply.

Compensation:

* Fee for Service: pay ranges from $38-45/session based on experience. Therapists earns 58-70K in their first year.
* You will receive a W2, PTO, sick time, and more
* Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance.
* Productivity Bonuses and semi-annual Profit share (increases over 5 years up to 10% of salary)
* 401K with employer match
* Paid supervision towards LCSW clinical hours.

We take professional support seriously. We are proud of our staff, believe in the important work they do, and strive to create a happy professional home for our team. You'll have lots of chances to collaborate with your colleagues in staff meetings, case conferences, and in one-on-one meetings with your director/manager and/or clinical supervisor as well.

LSW applicants: If you are working toward independent licensure, we provide the supervision that meets your license requirements.

Our office is a 1 minute walk from Journal Square Path Station and is easily accessible from NJ or downtown NYC.

Please email Kayla Ogletree, Team Manager, with your resume and a brief email to introduce yourself. Contact her at **kayla at resolutioncc.com**. Put "Jersey City Job Application" in the subject line.

**The Hire Date for this Position is September 16 2024.**

title: Restaurant Server
description:

Highgate is a premier real estate investment and hospitality management company widely recognized as an innovator in the industry. Highgate is the dominant player in U.S. gateway markets including New York, Boston, Miami, San Francisco and Honolulu, with a rapidly expanding presence in Europe, Latin America, and the Caribbean. Highgate’s portfolio of global properties represents an aggregate asset value exceeding $20B and generates over $5B in cumulative revenues. The company provides expert guidance through all stages of the hospitality property cycle, from planning and development through recapitalization or disposition. Highgate also has the creativity and bandwidth to develop bespoke hotel brands and utilizes industry-leading proprietary revenue management tools that identify and predict evolving market dynamics to drive out performance and maximize asset value. With an executive team consisting of some of the industry’s most experienced hotel management leaders, the company is a trusted partner for top ownership groups and major hotel brands. Highgate maintains corporate offices in London, New York, Dallas, and Seattle.

Graduate Princeton - Princeton, NJ
Overview:

The Restaurant Server is responsible for providing the highest quality of service to guests in an attentive, courteous, and efficient manner. He/she is also responsible for receiving and delivering guests orders and collecting payment.

* Must be able to maneuver throughout the dining area while carrying full trays of food & beverages.
* Must be able to effectively communicate both verbally and written, with all level of employees and guests in an attentive, friendly, courteous and service oriented manner.
* Must be effective at listening to, understanding, and clarifying concerns raised by employees and guests.
* Must be able to multitask and prioritize departmental functions to meet deadlines.
* Approach all encounters with guests and employees in an attentive, friendly, courteous and service-oriented manner.
* Attend all hotel required meetings and trainings.
* Maintain regular attendance in compliance with Highgate Hotel Standards, as required by scheduling, which will vary according to the needs of the hotel.
* Maintain high standards of personal appearance and grooming, which includes wearing the proper uniform and nametag.
* Comply with Highgate Hotel Standards and regulations to encourage safe and efficient hotel operations.
* Maximize efforts towards productivity, identify problem areas and assist in implementing solutions.
* Must be effective in handling problems, including anticipating, preventing, identifying and solving problems as necessary.
* Must be able to understand and apply complex information, data, etc. from various sources to meet appropriate objectives.
* Must be able to cross-train in other hotel related areas.
* Must be able to maintain confidentiality of information.
* Must be able to show initiative, including anticipating guest or operational needs.
* Perform other duties as requested by management.
* Maintain a friendly and warm demeanor at all times.

title: Director, Relationship Management
description:
Overview
  
At BNY, our culture empowers you to grow and succeed. As a leading global financial services company at the center of the world’s financial system we touch nearly 20% of the world’s investible assets. Every day around the globe, our 50,000+ employees bring the power of their perspective to the table to create solutions with our clients that benefit businesses, communities and people everywhere.
  
We continue to be a leader in the industry, awarded as a top home for innovators and for creating an inclusive workplace. Through our unique ideas and talents, together we help make money work for the world. This is what #LifeAtBNY is all about.
  
We’re seeking a future team member for the role of Director, Relationship Management to join our Treasury Services Business Development and Sales team. This role is located in New York, NY or Pittsburgh, PA
  
  

**In this role, you’ll make an impact in the following ways:**  

Drive Treasury Services revenue by prospecting and sourcing new client relationships and growing existing client portfolios
  
Conduct comprehensive client analysis to identify trends and insights across Cash Management, Payments and Trade and develop recommendations to leverage BNY Mellon’s core solutions
  
Partner across the firm to leverage relationships to proactively showcase and grow Treasury Services solutions, and proactively build and manage relationships with key internal stakeholders
  
Lead business process reviews related to sales opportunities and collaborate closely with cross-functional partners to ensure full understanding of client requirements and providing an optimal client experience
  
Offer strategic guidance and ideas to product managers to develop and refine solutions and offerings based on client feedback
  
Address complex client challenges by collaborating with internal stakeholders to address and remediate as appropriate
  
  

**To be successful in this role, we’re seeking the following:**  

Bachelors degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required. Advanced/graduate degree preferred.
  
10-12 years of total work experience preferred.
  
Treasury expertise – deep industry knowledge across payables, working capital optimization, cash management, liquidity, and FX experience
  
Successful client track record
  
Stakeholder management and executive communication – ability to influence across the bank and deliver executive level communications
  
Strong critical thinking and analytical skills
  
Applicable local/regional licenses or certifications as required by the business
  
At BNY, our culture speaks for itself. Here’s a few of our awards:
  
America’s Most Innovative Companies, Fortune, 2024
  
World’s Most Admired Companies, Fortune 2024
  
Human Rights Campaign Foundation, Corporate Equality Index, 100% score, 2023-2024
  
**Best Places to Work for Disability Inclusion , Disability:** IN – 100% score, 2023-2024
  
“Most Just Companies”, Just Capital and CNBC, 2024
  
Dow Jones Sustainability Indices, Top performing company for Sustainability, 2024
  
Bloomberg’s Gender Equality Index (GEI), 2023
  
  

**Our Benefits and Rewards:**  

BNY offers highly competitive compensation, benefits, and wellbeing programs rooted in a strong culture of excellence and our pay-for-performance philosophy. We provide access to flexible global resources and tools for your life’s journey. Focus on your health, foster your personal resilience, and reach your financial goals as a valued member of our team, along with generous paid leaves, including paid volunteer time, that can support you and your family through moments that matter.
  
BNY is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer - Underrepresented racial and ethnic groups/Females/Individuals with Disabilities/Protected Veterans.
  
  

BNY assesses market data to ensure a competitive compensation package for our employees. The base salary for this position is expected to be between $125,000 and $225,000 per year at the commencement of employment. However, base salary if hired will be determined on an individualized basis, including as to experience and market location, and is only part of the BNY total compensation package, which, depending on the position, may also include commission earnings, discretionary bonuses, short and long-term incentive packages, and Company-sponsored benefit programs.
  
This position is at-will and the Company reserves the right to modify base salary (as well as any other discretionary payment or compensation) at any time, including for reasons related to individual performance, change in geographic location, Company or individual department/team performance, and market factors.
  
  

**Employer Description:**  

For over 230 years, the people of BNY Mellon have been at the forefront of finance, expanding the financial markets while supporting investors throughout the investment lifecycle. BNY Mellon can act as a single point of contact for clients looking to create, trade, hold, manage, service, distribute or restructure investments and safeguards nearly one-fifth of the world's financial assets. BNY Mellon remains one of the safest, most trusted and admired companies. Every day our employees make their mark by helping clients better manage and service their financial assets around the world. Whether providing financial services for institutions, corporations or individual investors, clients count on the people of BNY Mellon across time zones and in 35 countries and more than 100 markets. It's the collective ambition, innovative thinking and exceptionally focused client service paired with a commitment to doing what is right that continues to set us apart. Make your mark: bnymellon.com/careers.
  
  

**EEO Statement:**  

BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans. Our ambition is to build the best global team – one that is representative and inclusive of the diverse talent, clients and communities we work with and serve – and to empower our team to do their best work. We support wellbeing and a balanced life, and offer a range of family-friendly, inclusive employment policies and employee forums.
company_description: The Bank of New York Mellon is one of the oldest financial institutions in the world, with prestigious clients including 80 percent of the Fortune 500.
